name: Infosys
title: 100K-Engineer AI Center of Excellence with Cursor

classification.classificationRationale: Model 2 (Center of Excellence). Infosys established a formal AI CoE with Cursor for software engineering, integrated into Topaz Fabric platform. The CoE provides centralized AI capability, governance, and an 'AI Engineering Experience Zone' for client demonstrations. 100,000 engineers receive standardized AI tooling through the central CoE. Structural orientation: the CoE is a named, formally announced entity with distinct leadership.

description:
Infosys and Cursor announced a strategic collaboration to establish an AI Center of Excellence for software engineering (January 27, 2026). The CoE equips over 100,000 Infosys software engineers with Cursor's agentic coding platform, integrated into Infosys Topaz Fabric (an agentic services suite combining infrastructure, models, data, applications, and workflows).

The CoE features an 'AI Engineering Experience Zone' for client demonstrations, positioning the capability as both internal enablement and external sales tool. Cursor reports enterprises using its platform saw a 39% increase in shipped pull requests.

This represents the largest announced AI developer tools CoE by engineer count (100,000), making it a significant data point for the Model 2 pattern at massive scale.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: CoE announced at company level. CEO Salil Parekh involved in announcement.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Central CoE provides standardized AI tooling to 100K engineers
observableMarkers.metrics: 100,000 engineers equipped. 39% increase in shipped PRs (Cursor claim). 64% of Fortune 1000 use Cursor.

quotes.text: redefining how global enterprises build and scale AI-powered digital solutions
quotes.speaker: Salil Parekh

layers.label: Session 002 Enrichment — Additional Sources & CEO Quote
layers.summary: Added CEO Salil Parekh quote on AI-first organization. Added additional sources (IndianWeb2, India Infoline). Confirmed Topaz Fabric integration as agentic services suite. Cursor CEO Michael Truell: 'Infosys' commitment to building an AI-first organization makes them a natural collaborator.' Stock rose ~1% on announcement.

layers.label: Initial Documentation
layers.summary: Infosys establishes AI CoE with Cursor for 100,000 software engineers. Integrated into Topaz Fabric platform. Includes AI Engineering Experience Zone for client demos.

sources.name: India Infoline — Infosys Collaborates with Cursor

openQuestions: How does the Cursor CoE relate to Infosys's existing AI training programs (reported 250K employees trained on AI)?
What metrics is Infosys tracking? Cursor reports 39% increase in shipped PRs — is Infosys measuring similarly?
Is this primarily a marketing/sales partnership or a genuine structural transformation?
How does this compare to TCS, Wipro, Accenture AI augmentation approaches?
What is the internal org structure of the CoE? Dedicated team or distributed?
taxonomyFeedback: At 100,000 engineers, this is the largest announced CoE by headcount. Scale may change the CoE dynamics — governance at 100K is different from governance at 100.
The dual purpose (internal enablement + client demo) blurs the line between CoE and product. The 'AI Engineering Experience Zone' is a sales tool.
